result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Kerber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA  Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No violent contact with: his father or brother.
Provide DNA sample if not yet previously done.

Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - STAYED. To be used at Agent's discretion.

Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-02-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Joshua J Kerber in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant will not enroll in drug/treatment court. Defense requests a date for a plea/sentencing in 2 weeks. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua J Kerber in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that the jury status date be used for a plea/sentencing date. Court grants request. Jury trial is adjourned. Motion hearing is withdrawn.

Defendant Joshua J Kerber in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense addresses filing motions. Court orders defense to file any motions by 09/18/2015 and State to respond by 09/30/2015. Court will give a motion date and a date for jury status/jury trial.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: August 24, 2015
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 7/23/15 preliminary hearing.
Hearing on August 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joshua J Kerber in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Mary Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for preliminary hearing. Officer Natalie Johnston sworn and testified. Testimony closed. State moves for bindover without arguments. Defense asks that the court not bindover and dismiss the charges. Court finds there is probable cause and binds the defendant over. Information filed by the State. Reading waived.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED by Defense. Defense requests another date in 30 days. Court grants request. Discovery handed from State to Defense.  Defense to advise on the next date how this matter will proceed.  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Detainer lift acknowledgment filed by Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility
Detainer lifted, faxed to MSDF.

Defendant Joshua J Kerber in court, in custody, via video with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense advises this matter is progressing as set. Defendant is completing his ATR. Defense requests bail be modified to a signature bond on 15CM121 with the same conditions. Court grants request and modifies bail to $750.00 signature bond on file 15CM121. Bail to remain as set on the other files. Cases continued as set.
Preliminary hearing on July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jorge R Fragoso in court.   Defendant Joshua J Kerber did not appear.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 10:50. Court contacted the facility via video where the defendant was at, but defendant was not there. Defense advised his client is to do a 90 day program at MSDF. Time limits are tolled on 15CF296. Defense requests a date in 90 days for a Preliminary Hearing. Court grants request.  Court will also give another date in 45 days to review the defendant's status. Defendant to appear by video.  Hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
